messages: 664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a (17:24): Hello
664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a (17:25): I'm writing a small software with HTML5 and websocket
664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a (17:27): and I don't understand why there is an error when I try to connect me to the server
664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a (17:27): In my shell, the error is : Error during WebSocket handshake: 'Sec-WebSocket-Accept' header is missing
664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a (17:28): Could You help me please ?
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (17:33): does https://github.com/miksago/node-websocket-server/issues/71 help?
0e5e37c845fffd6712293b5e7c041021 (17:33): ‚òÖ Issue #71 on node-websocket-server, reported by superfeedr (5m, 2w ago): Issue with Chrome 15
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (17:51): Hello
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (17:53): appending over 100 children is faster when the parent element is removed from the DOM during the operation
664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a (17:53): 0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b thanks I am going to test with an old version of chromium
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (17:54): so it makes sense to always remove element when doing heavy DOM manipulation
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (17:54): the problem is that it's tricky to bring the element back into its original position
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (17:55): is it possible to implement hide/show methods that could remember exact position of the node in dom tree?
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (17:59): Why with this code on chrome is not creating the table notes and is not giving me any error? http://pastebin.com/2EKgiaBM
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (18:00): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6, remove the element and record it's nextSibling
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (18:01): then use parent.insertBefore(original, sibling)
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:01): 664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a: you should be using https://github.com/LearnBoost/websocket.io, it's the best WebSockets module for Node.js
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (18:01): and if there is no next sibling, you can fall back to appendChild
664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a (18:02): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: For the moment, I developpe from scratch my server and my client
664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a (18:02): I read some tutorials and I code a test
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:02): 0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b: ahh, neat
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:03): 0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b: and if element not have next sibling I will have to record the parent and use appendChild
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:03): s/not have/does not have
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (18:03): correct. So make sure to record both parent and nextsibling.
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (18:03): because both are blanked once you remove the node =)
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:05): 664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a: you are writing yet another WebSockets server? :P
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:05): 664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a: there is already a dozen of them
664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a (18:06): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: Is there one easy in python ?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:07): 664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a: no idea about python, but there are at least 5 implementations for Node.js
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:07): but I have found websocket.io to be the only one fully usable
664b90e089e11cf09547badf36a5de9a (18:17): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: oki thanks, I make a clone of the project
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (18:36): someone that is familiar with web sql api can help me please?
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (18:38): no, because web sql no longer exists.
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (18:39): it was deprecated when no one could agree on what it should do, exactly, and not enough people could justify the need for SQL. Instead you get indexedDB
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (18:39): http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (18:40): 0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b: I know that but I cant use indexed db on safar for example
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:43): 42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde: IndexedDB already ships with WebKit, it
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:43): it's just a matter of time when it will be available in Safari
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (18:44): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: I konw that is a matter of time but I need know taht app goes on safari
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (18:45): looking on canIuse say that on safary doesnt go indexed db
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:45): 42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde: have you thought about using localStorage?
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (18:46): I need something to separe things
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:46): you can store any JSON structure in localStorage
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (18:47): arecould you show me an example please?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:47): though it would not be as efficient as IndexedDB if you need to query data a lot
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (18:49): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: could you show me an example of that please?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:50): 42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde: I use those two helper functions in Coffeescript: https://gist.github.com/1653401
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:50): 42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde: so that I could e.g. store a javascript object like this:
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:50): > localStorage.set person, {name: 'John", age: '21'}
94b029eb4cb3bc044600f8d17be7af95 (18:50): <hint>:1:24: parse error on input `,'
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:51): > localStorage.set 'person', {name: 'John", age: '21'}
94b029eb4cb3bc044600f8d17be7af95 (18:51): <hint>:1:20: lexical error in string/character literal at character 'e'
cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8 (18:52): any ideea why eval, or native json.parse won't parse a perfectly valid json? checked in json lint.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (18:52): Maybe json lint is wrong?
94b029eb4cb3bc044600f8d17be7af95 (18:54): <hint>:1:9: parse error on input `in'
cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8 (18:54): also tried in http://json.parser.online.fr/, and it's also able to parse it corectly, no errors
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:54): 94b029eb4cb3bc044600f8d17be7af95 can't talk CoffeeScript ;(
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (18:55): cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8, I'm afraid I can't tell you what's wrong if I don't see the code ;)
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:55): btw, why JSON.parse() does not return exact line numbers when it fails?
cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8 (18:56): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: this is the json, http://pastebin.com/U1grz75n
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:57): on Chrome I'm getting errors such as "Unexpected token <random sign here" if the file is malformed
cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8 (18:57): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: and thanks for taking a look
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (19:02): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: I have some basci exmaple running saving data as strign and as json :D
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (19:02): you say that I would have one json object per thing that I need?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:03): 42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde: what do you mean by "thing"?
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (19:03): I have diferrent element, objects like note, log and user
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:04): yeah, it would make sense to keep them as localStorage.log, localStorage.user, etc...
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:05): 42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde: just make sure you won't exceed the 5MB limit
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:05): or something around that
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:15): cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8, so JSON.parse('{ "a": "\"" }') fails...
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:15): Turns out that you need to double-escape

cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8 (19:16): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: I can't modify the reponse, since it's from a 3rd party web service. but I ended up not doing any JSON.parse, and just doing var = response, and that worked.
cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8 (19:21): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: actualy, I assigned it (as on object, not string), stringified it, then parsed it again. only thing that worked. crazy
cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8 (19:22): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: yeah, wat
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (19:26): localstorage infromation is losed when the user cloe the browser?
cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8 (19:26): 42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde: nope, only when he delets it himself
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (19:26): cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8: the way to elete taht info is with clear() right?
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (19:27): or removeItem()
cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8 (19:27): 42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde: yeah
cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8 (19:28): 42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde: or the user can remove it from the clear cache dialogs
42b665b14d4d8b5d1fe675939876ecde (19:29): cc0c7fea8ba363e24b450d3bedffdfd8: thanks!
